      • isPalindrome

        public static java.lang.Boolean isPalindrome(java.lang.String word)
        isPalindrome Takes a string removes spaces, commans, and periods. Then evaluates if is a palindrome.
        Parameters:
        word, - the string being evaluated.
        Returns:
        boolean, return true if the value is palindrome and false otherwise

      • saveLine

        public static void saveLine(java.io.File file,
                            java.lang.String[] words,
                            java.lang.Boolean[] palindrome)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        saveLine Takes a file, an array on strings, and an array of boolean values and writes the array to a file if it is a palindrome.
        Parameters:
        file, - the file that is being written to.
        words, - an array of strings that is being written to the file if its parallel array of boolean values holds true
        boolean, - an array of the palindrome boolean values of each line.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveResults

        public static void saveResults(java.io.File file,
                               java.lang.String[] words,
                               int length)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        saveResults takes a file, array of strings, and an integer of the length of the array. The amount of characters is counted and is writen to the file along with the array length. Then the number of words in each line is counted and divided by the number of lines to get the average number of words per line. That value is then written to the file.
        Parameters:
        File - file, the file being written to
        String - [] words, the strings being evaluated
        int - length, the length of the array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fileLength

        public static int fileLength(java.lang.String fileName)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        fileLength Calculates how many lines a file has to set the length of the arrays created in the main method.
        Parameters:
        fileName, - the file that is being read in and is having its lines counted.
        Returns:
        lines, the amount of lines in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sortArray

        public static void sortArray(java.lang.String[] words)
        sortArray Sorts an array of Strings in alphabetical order by converting the first character in a String to ASCII and compaing it to another via a bubble sort method. If the letters are matching, the next character is compared.
        Parameters:
        String - [] words, the array of Strings to be sorted
